Pre-Game Insights: Guinea has won three of their last five games and drawn one, with only one loss. They haven't conceded more than one goal in any of these matches, and all but one game featured fewer than three goals.
Senegal are in excellent form, winning four and drawing one of their last five games, conceding just one goal in the process.
Mohamed Bayo, who is set to lead Guinea’s frontline for the third consecutive game, aims to increase his goal tally for his country, currently standing at four.
Ismaila Sarr has already made a significant impact with three goal contributions in the tournament’s initial two games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Guinea will face the absence of their captain, Francois Kamano, who received a straight red card in the 1-1 draw against Cameroon in the initial game.
Senegal, on the other hand, may continue to be without defender Moussa Niakhite, who missed the second game due to an injury sustained in the first.
Others: The match will determine the Group C winner.
The predicted lineup for Guinea is (4-2-3-1): Kone; A. Conte, Diakhaby, Jeanvier, S. Sylla; Moriba, Konate; Guilavogui, A. Camara, Kante; Bayo
The predicted lineup for Senegal is (4-3-3): Mendy; Jakobs, Koulibaly, Diallo, Diatta; Ciss, Gueye, Sarr; Mane, Jackson, I. Sarr
The match is expected to be closely fought, with Senegal possessing the quality to clinch a narrow victory.
